001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.validator;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.log.LogApi;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.Assertion;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionResult;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.exceptions.InvalidAssertionException;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.util.AssertionUtil;
008import io.restassured.response.Response;
009import java.util.HashMap;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
013import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
014
015/**
016 * Implements response validation for API tests.
017 *
018 * <p>This class validates HTTP responses against assertions, ensuring compliance with expected
019 * values in status codes, headers, and body content.
020 *
021 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
022 */
023@Component
024@NoArgsConstructor
025public class RestResponseValidatorImpl implements RestResponseValidator {
026
027   /**
028    * Validates an API response against the provided assertions.
029    *
030    * <p>Extracts response status, headers, and body values based on defined assertions and
031    * performs validation using {@link AssertionUtil}.
032    *
033    * @param response   The API response to validate.
034    * @param assertions The assertions used to verify response correctness.
035    * @param <T>        The expected data type for assertion validation.
036    * @return A list of assertion results indicating pass or failure for each assertion.
037    * @throws IllegalArgumentException  If response or assertions are null.
038    * @throws InvalidAssertionException If assertion targets or keys are invalid.
039    */
040   @Override
041   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
042   public <T> List<AssertionResult<T>> validateResponse(final Response response, Assertion... assertions) {
043      LogApi.info("Starting response validation with {} assertion(s).", assertions.length);
044      Map<String, T> data = new HashMap<>();
045
046      for (Assertion assertion : assertions) {
047         Object target = assertion.getTarget();
048         if (!(target instanceof RestAssertionTarget restTarget)) {
049            throw new InvalidAssertionException("Invalid or unknown assertion target: " + target);
050         }
051
052         switch (restTarget) {
053            case STATUS -> handleStatusAssertion(response, data, assertion);
054            case BODY -> handleBodyAssertion(response, data, assertion);
055            case HEADER -> handleHeaderAssertion(response, data, assertion);
056            default -> throw new InvalidAssertionException("Unhandled assertion target: " + target);
057         }
058      }
059
060      printAssertionTarget((Map<String, Object>) data);
061      return AssertionUtil.validate(data, List.of(assertions));
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Logs the extracted validation targets for debugging purposes.
066    *
067    * @param data The extracted response data mapped to assertion keys.
068    */
069   protected void printAssertionTarget(Map<String, Object> data) {
070      LogApi.extended("Validation target: [{}]", data.toString());
071   }
072
073
074   private <T> void handleStatusAssertion(Response response, Map<String, T> data, Assertion assertion) {
075      final String key = "AssertionKeyForStatus";
076      data.put(key, (T) Integer.valueOf(response.getStatusCode()));
077      assertion.setKey(key);
078   }
079
080   private <T> void handleBodyAssertion(Response response, Map<String, T> data, Assertion assertion) {
081      String key = assertion.getKey();
082      if (key == null) {
083         throw new InvalidAssertionException("Assertion must have a non-null key. Key must contain a valid "
084               + "JsonPath expression.");
085      }
086
087      T value = response.jsonPath().get(key);
088      if (value == null) {
089         throw new IllegalArgumentException("JsonPath expression: '" + key + "' not found in response body.");
090      }
091
092      data.put(key, value);
093   }
094
095   private <T> void handleHeaderAssertion(Response response, Map<String, T> data, Assertion assertion) {
096      String key = assertion.getKey();
097      if (key == null) {
098         throw new InvalidAssertionException("Assertion must have a non-null key.");
099      }
100
101      String header = response.getHeader(key);
102      if (header == null) {
103         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Header '" + key + "' not found in response.");
104      }
105
106      data.put(key, (T) header);
107   }
108}
